channel.title: what???
channel.description: there's this commercial going around about this super smart kid, he's getting funding for his new, innovative, and stylish invention. first, the picture of a [url=https://i50.tinypic.com/35m1cnn.png]normal bus[/url] now, i present to you, his stunning and simply amazing [url=https://i48.tinypic.com/dfujr5.png]green shield bus[/url] he got twenty five thousand USD > :frowning:

item.title: what???
item.dc:creator: Deadline99
item.description:
Probably. But most teens are pretty fucking stupid, and then the “Everyone’s Special” group goes off and gives an autistic kid the ability to buy whatever the fuck he wants to spend on his design. There’s 60 billion other ways to make a bus more fuel efficient anyway, like cutting unneeded areas of space.

EDIT: found this in the comments.

this is such a flawed idea, what was Pepsi thinking by supporting this? First of all, school buses drive so slow and stop so frequently that drag coefficients mean almost nothing, hence the reason they are so boxy to begin with second of all, the premise is grossly oversimplified and REAL wind tunnel tests might﻿ reveal it actually has a higher drag coefficient due to skin friction furthermore, what about rain/snow/etc.? no windshield wipers, defrosters, etc. terrible idea, dumb move Pepsi.

Read full topic
